title: Headlight Assembly - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note the routing of the LF antenna harness for installation.
Note the orientation of the LF antenna for installation.
Note the routing of the harnesses under the flyscreen for installation.
Remove the fixings and detach the LF antenna from the flyscreen mounting.
Disconnect the LF antenna electrical connector from the main harness and remove the LF antenna.
Disconnect the two handlebar subharness connectors and the twist grip position sensor connector from the main harness.
Note the position of the two cable ties securing the harness for installation.
Cut the cable ties securing the harness to the flyscreen mounting.
Release the fixings and detach the flyscreen mounting from the front subframe.
Note the routing of the headlight harnesses and their retaining S-clips on the front subframe for installation.
The main harness for the right hand headlight can be identified by the red tape on it.
Turn the flyscreen mounting over and disconnect the headlight connectors from the main harness.
Detach the headlight leads from the S-clips on the subframe.
Note the orientation of the headlight clamp for installation.
Support the headlight assembly, release the fixings, remove the clamp and headlight assembly.

search: Headlight Assembly - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Flyscreen - Removal
Note the routing of the LF antenna harness for installation.
Note the orientation of the LF antenna for installation.
Note the routing of the harnesses under the flyscreen for installation.
Remove the fixings and detach the LF antenna from the flyscreen mounting.
Disconnect the LF antenna electrical connector from the main harness and remove the LF antenna.
Fixings
Electrical connector
LF Antenna
Disconnect the two handlebar subharness connectors and the twist grip position sensor connector from the main harness.
Note the position of the two cable ties securing the harness for installation.
Cut the cable ties securing the harness to the flyscreen mounting.
Release the fixings and detach the flyscreen mounting from the front subframe.
Twist grip position sensor connector
Handlebar sub harness connectors
Cable tie (one of two shown)
Flyscreen mounting fixings
Note the routing of the headlight harnesses and their retaining S-clips on the front subframe for installation.
The main harness for the right hand headlight can be identified by the red tape on it.
Turn the flyscreen mounting over and disconnect the headlight connectors from the main harness.
Left hand headlight connector
Right hand headlight connector
Right hand direction indicator connectors
Detach the headlight leads from the S-clips on the subframe.
Note the orientation of the headlight clamp for installation.
Support the headlight assembly, release the fixings, remove the clamp and headlight assembly.
Fixings
Clamp
